# docker_volume (Resource)

Manages Docker volumes.

## Example Usage

```terraform
# Simple local volume
resource "docker_volume" "data" {
  name = "app-data"
}

# Volume with labels
resource "docker_volume" "logs" {
  name   = "app-logs"
  driver = "local"

  labels = {
    environment = "development"
    managed_by  = "terraform"
  }
}

# Volume with driver options (NFS example)
resource "docker_volume" "nfs" {
  name   = "nfs-volume"
  driver = "local"

  driver_opts = {
    type   = "nfs"
    o      = "addr=192.168.1.100,rw"
    device = ":/path/to/share"
  }
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `name` (String) The name of the Docker volume.

### Optional

- `driver` (String) The driver that this volume uses. Default is 'local'.
- `driver_opts` (Map of String) Options specific to the volume driver.
- `force` (Boolean) If true, forces the removal of the volume even if it's in use. Default is false.
- `labels` (Map of String) User-defined key/value metadata.

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) The ID of this resource.
- `mountpoint` (String) The mount point of the volume on the host.
